intro: Pentameris airoides, commonly known as the golden cupplant, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a distinctive rosette of basal leaves that are deeply lobed and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and meadows. Pentameris airoides plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is valued for its ornamental and ecological significance.
